Ultra Conservative Christian Lady Goes To Museum, Tries To Debunk Evolution, Fails Beyond Miserably

November 26, 2014 in believing in something, crazy people, debunking evolution singlehandedly, dinosaurs, evolution, fact checking, holy smokes, mission accomplished, museum, nailed it, oh wow, please please please send your kids to public schools, religion, wtf did i just watch?
Facebook Twitter Google+

This is a video of ultra conservative Christian Megan Fox (not that Megan Fox, trust me) taking a trip to the Field Museum of Natural History in Chicago to debunk their 'Evolving Earth' exhibit and audit it for a liberal (aka scientific, in her mind) bias. It starts off awful and ends worse, and that's even looking past the shoddy camerawork (which wasn't easy). I posted three short teaser highlights for the video first, then the whole 30-minute thing in case you really, really like torturing yourself. Although I'd still suggest you try hanging yourself from the ceiling with some of those giant meat-hooks in your back first.

Keep going for the videos while I cross all my fingers and my toes Megan is just a very convincing troll.

Thanks to moyer, Jackie and Porterhouse Pete, who are still rubbing their eyeballs really hard and painfully until they see colors.

  • Miso Corny

    I'll go against the grain and actually write a worthwhile comment.

    First, she doesn't mention God or creationism in the clips. (I didn't watch the the 30 minute clip, because her rational on Eukaryotes sounded like a Pete Holmes Batman clip. At least that's the voice I heard her talking in.)

    Second, arguing grammar is important to science and scientists. If I get up and present my research (which is molecular evolution/genome evolution) and I say things like "is", "Was", "Were", "all available evidence supports", etc I'd be run out of the room. Every evolutionary biologist knows that you can't use those small words, because they are emphasizing your findings as fact, and al evolutionists should conclude that no matter what they discover, there is ALWAYS the possibility of another hypothesis.

    Three, it is still called the THEORY of evolution. It is not called the Law of evolution, like there are laws of physics, or Laws of gravity. It's a theory because not all available evidence has supported it.

    Four, fossil records do NOT support evolution, thus the "missing link". Also, comparative analysis between humans and chimps can only say that there was "something" that was neither human nor chimp that preceded the both of us. We did not come from chimps.

    Fifth, the problem with the theory of evolution, and climate science, is that there are "GEEKS" like you all, that are out there slamming people for not having the same view as you do. That is now scientific. That is madness. Modern agnostics and atheists act more like medieval religious fanatics than modern day religious fanatics.

    I don't care what the woman believes, because none of it matters. It doesn't matter to her modern health care, diet or well being, and it doesn't matter to mine. Whether she believes we came from unicellular organisms doesn't matter. What does matter IN AMERICA and amongst INTELLIGENT, SCIENTIFIC minds is that people are allowed to have their opinion and disagree with others for ANY reason whatsoever. This woman actually has valid points, pointing out the fact that no scientists can accurately conclude what was where billions of years ago, the fossil record does not support evolution, evolution is still a theory and that presenting scientific hypotheses and theories as facts is dangerous.

    It is more dangerous than believing in an invisible flying man in the sky.

I mean, there's a lot of people who just say, "Bible says 6000 years old and no dinosaurs. END OF DISCUSSION." I at least appreciate that she didn't go down that path. I mean, it still hurts to watch but I'm just saying its a start.
